paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant c.290C>A; p.Ser97Tyr, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis with symptoms including peripheral neuropathy, cardiomyopathy, and autonomic neuropathy.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Significant lower extremity weakness, numbness and pain in hands and feet, swelling in feet and ankles.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 45-year-old Caucasian male... with complaints of significant lower extremity weakness, requiring assistance to walk, and a weight loss of 40 pounds.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to a mixed phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: The variant has been documented in a handful of families previously, indicating it segregates with disease.
variants.additional_notes: The variant has been associated with aggressive disease manifestation.
key_quotes: This case highlights the aggressive nature of this mutation (c.290C>A; p.Ser97Tyr) as it can lead to symptom manifestation at a relatively younger age and rapid clinical deterioration after symptom onset.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant was extracted accurately.
